meanings.definition: To obtain something by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He weaselled his way into getting the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The thief weaselled the jewels from the safe.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox weaselled the chickens out of their coop.
meanings.sent4: She weaselled her opponent's strategy and won the game.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon weaselled the snacks from the picnic basket.

meanings.definition: To achieve something by cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She weaselled her way to the top of the leaderboard.
meanings.sent2: The con artist weaselled money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat weaselled its way into the closed room.
meanings.sent4: He weaselled his plan past the strict supervisor.
meanings.sent5: The cunning detective weaselled the truth out of the suspect.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or deceive someone in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The scammer weaselled money from innocent people.
meanings.sent2: She weaselled her brother into doing her chores.
meanings.sent3: The tricky magician weaselled the audience with his illusions.
meanings.sent4: He weaselled his way out of taking responsibility for his actions.
meanings.sent5: The crafty salesman weaselled customers into buying unnecessary products.
